text.text_translated: Earthquakes damage all structures, including bridges, but fortunately this type of damage is not very common with modern ones. Engineers have learned to design them in areas that are more resistant to movement.

feedback.feedback: This is a strong B1 performance. You have successfully combined two ideas into a single, correct compound sentence using 'but', which is an excellent demonstration of B1-level writing. Your vocabulary choices, such as using 'not very common' for 'relatively infrequent', are appropriate and maintain the original meaning. The text is factually accurate, though for a perfect score, remember to include all key details like 'in earthquake zones'.
